intro: Rhodanthemum hosmariense, commonly known as the Hosmariense shrub, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Uruguay. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to orange, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Rhodanthemum hosmariense is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
